examples: The prince swore she would be punished for her dastardly deeds
It's the story of a woman who plots a dastardly revenge on her unfaithful lover
Danger did not daunt the hero
Frequent imprisonment by various regimes did not daunt the courage of Nawal

debacle.definition: A sudden and ignominious failure; a fiasco
examples: His first performance was a debacle : the audience booed him off the stage
After the debacle of the war the world was never the same again
The governor debased himself by lying to the public
The holiday has been debased by commercialism

dearth.definition: A scarcity or lack of something
examples: The next danger was from the people, who were infuriated by the dearth of corn
There's a real dearth in knowledge about how to manage money
